intro: Pseudobaeckea cordata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geebung, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal and open forest habitats. It is often found in areas with full sun to partial shade and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens. Pseudobaeckea cordata is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that thrives in well-drained conditions.
